clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study, Safety and Efficacy, Ahmed Glaucoma Drainage Device, Model M4 Model S2 in Neovascular Glaucoma
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study of the Safety and Efficacy of the Ahmed Glaucoma Valve Drainage Device, Model M4 (High Density Porous Polyethylene) and the Model S2 (Polypropylene) in Patients With Neovascular Glaucoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Asociación para Evitar la Ceguera en México

clinical_study.source: Asociación para Evitar la Ceguera en México

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: Prospectively evaluate the safety and efficacy of the Ahmed Glaucoma Drainage Device, model M4 compared with the model S2.
Method: Mexican patients with Neovascular Glaucoma will be randomly included for each group (M4 and S2). They will be operated using conventional techniques and creating a sub-episcleral tunnel to place the valve's tube in the anterior chamber. They will be monitoring for one year and the results will be evaluated with respect to a postoperative reduction in pressure, changes in visual acuity, the need for drugs and complications, in addition to the demographic characteristics of each group.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse effects

arm_group.description: Surgically Implant an Ahmed Glaucoma Drainage Device Model S2 in Neovascular Glaucoma Patients and evaluate the IOP evolution, complications and need for medication to control IOP

intervention.description: Surgically Implant an Ahmed Glaucoma Drainage Device Models S2 and M4, evaluare IOP evolution, complications and need for medication to control IOP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with diagnosis of Neovascular glaucoma
- High IOP despite topical treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Mental disorders
- Previous glaucoma surgery
- Patients older than 18 years
